channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023110447
item.description:
Report E-2023110447

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: approximately 1 ounce of NALCO EC3045A (NA1993) was released from a 330-gallon metal tote due to improper packaging. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was contacted to assist with the cleanup of material.

item.title: Report X-2023110989
item.description:
Report X-2023110989

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to load one, we saw a couple drops on the floor surround the drum, we put it in a hazmat tote and took it to the cage for processing DescribePack: there is a dent right below the brim of the drum and one on the lip of the drum, it also must have been underneath heavier items because if you tilt it the seal on the pour spout is bad and it leaks out of there as well, but upright it doesn't leak but a few drops if its slightly moved. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put in a bin upright and put in the hazmat cage under the hood.

item.title: Report X-2023110889
item.description:
Report X-2023110889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to 5- gallon metal pail / drum wet and leaking package found on trailer # 538459 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection 1 x 5 gallons metal pail / drum of ethanol 190 P had crack on the bottom of the container allowing all 5 gallons to release from container. no outer package was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous material followed contents contained and awaiting deposition. DescribePack: 1 5 gallon metal pail / drum had crack on the bottom of the container allowing all 5 gallons of to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pail/ drum was placed in a hazmat lined tote

DescribePack: 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of old limey lime deposit remover had loose caps allowing .25 gallons to release from each bottle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bagged lined tote

item.title: Report E-2023110509
item.description:
Report E-2023110509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, one (1) 204-gallon tote of UN1830 was punctured and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. . ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1830-impacted trailer and dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. ES personnel transferred the product from the 275-gallon tote to a 275-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal and the damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110446
item.description:
Report E-2023110446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 25-pound pail of UN2880 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail of calcium hypochlorite and all the released product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110501
item.description:
Report E-2023110501

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: YORK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was on store lot unloading compartment number 4 of our DOT tank trailer. Driver did not latch the fittings to the drop tube correctly. When the material started to flow it 'jumped' like normal and the hose disconnected from the drop tube resulting in a spill of diesel fuel of around 170 gallons. The driver stopped the flow of product and contacted the local fire department. York local fire department personnel, in house clean up, and 3rd party clean up teams all responded to the scene. We also filed a report with the Pennsylvania Dept. of Environmental Protection.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed on side, not following the direction arrows and the weight of first can was on second can and this led the lid to pop. Popped lid led to internal leakage. DescribePack: Top of can, lid popped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in HazMat tub and taken to HazMat secure area.

item.title: Report E-2023110399
item.description:
Report E-2023110399

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of regulated UN1133 "Tensorbond C307 Low VOC Sprayable Contact Adhesive" arrived damaged at Terminal XPB. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was damaged due to freight impact as a result of a load shift. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 85-metal drum overpack containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material used, the punctured drum, the remaining material, and the issued PPE. Waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110546
item.description:
Report X-2023110546

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to load side by a manager pertaining a leaking hazmat. QA arrived with spill pads for the spill and placed the leaking hazmat in a spill proof tote to contain the spill. DescribePack: There was a small puncture on the bottom of the container due to not having enough inner packing to protect the container for shipping. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA responded quickly with spill pads and a spill proof tote to contain the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023110507
item.description:
Report X-2023110507

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package fell off the belt at about 10pm and put aside. It wasn't reported to QA until 3am, when the package handler on next shift tried to move it and about an ounce spilled out. It was immediately put in a lined bin and taken to QA to be processed as a damage. The small amount that leaked out almost immediately evaporated. DescribePack: When the drum fell, it bent the top of the drum, forming a small hole or crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The tiny amount that spilled had evaporated by the time i got there.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.description:
Report E-2023110147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture a 55G DM of ROCRYL 420 (HEA-LA) released 3 cups of material into the trailer floor. The damaged drum was overpacked and the impacted surfaces were cleaned and neutralized with a soda ash solution. (1) 95G DF - Overpacked Drum and (1) 55G DF - Impacted absorbents were created as waste and were staged and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110128
item.description:
Report E-2023110128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: GLEN MILLS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported (2) 275 gallon metal totes containing 5405 Fuel Corrosion Inhibitor (UN1993), which arrived at the terminal with liquid leaking from the top of the totes due to an improperly sealed cap, approximately half a cups worth combined. The terminal wiped the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into a 10 gallon poly drum for disposal. The terminal tightened the caps on the totes and moved them on to the consignee.

It was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 85Gal DF was overpacked with product and absorbents along with PPE and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023101225

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO A "KEEP FROZEN" AND "PERISHABLE" STICKER ON THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED NON-REGULATED NORDIC GEL PACKS AND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2023110161
item.description:
Report E-2023110161

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 30-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed soda ash to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101452
item.description:

item.title: Report X-2023101435
item.description:
Report X-2023101435

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager called it out on the radio a leaking hazmat and that there was a strong odor in the trailer. One of the admins grabbed all the hazmat totes and PPE and went over to check out the damaged hazmat. Discovered three hazmat were on its side in the trailer by station 282. All three of them were not upright by the orientation arrows. They were placed into a red hazardous waste totes and brought over to QA. DescribePack: The caps are vented and since they were found on its side and not upright. It leaked out slowly through the vented cap. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: put all the bottles upright to prevent from leaking.
